snippet: A nun and two fellow protesters were convicted of interfering with national security when they broke into a nuclear weapons facility and defaced a uranium processing plant.
abstract: Eighty-three-year-old nun Megan Rice and fellow protestors Michael Walli and Greg Boertje-Obed are convicted of interfering with national security after breaking into nuclear weapons facility in Oak Ridge, Tenn, and defacing uranium processing plant.
lead_paragraph: A nun and two fellow protesters were convicted of interfering with national security when they broke into a nuclear weapons facility and defaced a uranium processing plant.

headline.main: Tennessee: Nun Among Three Convicted in Weapons Protest
headline.print_headline: Tennessee: Nun Among Three Convicted In Weapons Protest
